masterFinding.verificationInstructions:
Verification Instructions

Test application functionality that can be used to access files, such as uploaded files, on the server using a complete path (such as C:\inetpub\wwwroot\etc..) as a parameter value. Test if arbitrary paths are accepted as parameters to allow access to files that should not be accessible on the file system.

If directory traversal sequence is needed, report directory traversal instead of this.

Test outbound connectivity using UNC paths and HTTP URLs.

Reporting Requirements
  1. Screenshot affected page

  2. Show request containing an absolute path

  3. Modify request to access files that should not be accessible

  4. Show the impact of the vulnerability


Further Testing

The following findings should be reported if applicable:
  • Insufficient egress filtering

  • Cleartext passwords stored
masterFinding.remediationInstructions: Ensure that server-side controls are put in place that validate and restrict reading of files based on extensions, locations, and content to only that which is required for a defined business purpose.
masterFinding.name: Arbitrary File Read
masterFinding.businessImpact: With arbitrary read access to the server an attacker may be able to read source code, configuration files, and passwords that could compromise the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the affected systems.
masterFinding.description: It is possible to read arbitrary files on the affected systems.
